message: Which mental issues would be ok? Because some are more severe than others. How about our LEO's and military that suffer from PTSD/depression? Do the permit holders get grandfathered in or do they have to be evaluated now? Or do their medical records just get looked at? Which then lead to the question of how many people would NOT talk to their doctor because rights would be withheld. There are already too many folks who aren't willing to fill out forms we have because """"the governments gonna watch them"""". Who's going to check the medical records, Government or private companies? Will hippa laws have to be rewritten? I'm all for gun control, but this mental health issue is too big to resolve. It's not the way to go.

The girl, who was not identified by authorities, was taken to a local hospital to receive medical attention along with a 19-year-old woman who received second-hand spray, police said. Wisconsin State Journal reporter Molly Beck was next to the woman when the confrontation occurred and reported getting pepper spray on her as well.

Funny.... Donald J. Trump is a Republican, and he doesn't seem to be having trouble with the media. Has anyone noticed that Ted Cruz is ALWAYS looking for someone to blame for his own failures? He blames the GOP leaders in the Senate and House. He blames President Obama. He blames the Supreme Court. Now he blames the media. Is it possible that maybe -- just maybe -- Senator Ted Cruz over-promised his voters something he KNEW he could not deliver...just so he could get elected?

#Thecove is equally important with regards to saving these creatures. Dolphins are being killed by the hundred or captured to be sold to these odious parks. Anyone that hasn't seen it (The Cove) should, it's on YouTube.

Hunting is conservation. All the meat is eaten (by locals mostly) and the money goes directly to the people doing the actual protection/conservation work. People who think that donations and photo safaris are going to fix the problem are Saving these animals to death.

A 2700 year old papyrus mentioning Jerusalem written in paleo-Hebrew is as much a treasure of Palestinian history as it is of Jewish history, as it is of world history. Propping it up as a exclusively Jewish artifact because it's in Hebrew (as if Palestinian history can't include the Jewish history of Palestine) is as absurd as the denigration of Arabic as a non-Jewish language, when in fact some of the great works of Jewish philosophy and poetry are in Arabic. To draw nationalist, sectarian lines around complex, multifaceted cultural products ignores the deep connections of all peoples in the region.

My baby girl is 23 and still gets one gift from Santa. We have a don't-ask-don't-tell policy regarding Santa. My husband and I have no clue when she realized we were Santa and she's more than happy to play along!!!
